description: A type of Corella from Australia, this white cockatoo is distinguished by its very long, slender upper beak, which it uses for digging up roots and tubers. They have a pink splash around the face.
temperament: Extremely intelligent, playful, and can be very affectionate. They are known for being one of the best talkers among the cockatoos. They have a strong instinct to dig and chew.
loudness: Very Loud. They have a loud, multi-part call that can be very noisy.
vocalization: Considered one of the best talkers of all cockatoos, capable of learning extensive vocabularies with remarkable clarity.
dietaryNeeds: A pelleted diet with lots of fresh vegetables. They need a constant supply of wood and other safe materials to chew to satisfy their digging and chewing instincts.
healthPointers: Can live for 70+ years. Beak can become overgrown if not provided with sufficient chewing opportunities. They can be prone to behavioral issues if bored.
housing: Not suitable for apartments. Requires a very large, extremely durable cage with lots of wood to destroy. Minimum 36"W x 24"D x 48"H.
